Issues.Title: Add release notes for ML.NET 0.8
Issues.Body: This adds release notes for ML.NET 0.8.

Issues.Title: Clean up of TextLoader constructor
Issues.Body:
Fixes #1611.

1. Hid the constructor of `TextLoader` that takes Arguments, and exposed `HasHeader` and `SeparatorChars` as non-advanced parameters. 
2. Made Create methods internal and modified the code accordingly. 
3. Added comments for the public facing constructor that was retained.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Clean up of TextLoader constructor" (#1784)

Issues.Title: Add fixes to prevent potential build failures due to redist copying
Issues.Body: Adds a new build script flag that allows specifying that certain RID agnostic files inside redist should not be built/executed. This is used to prevent the DNNImageFeaturizer models from being copied on each leg causing possible build failures. Instead, the copying only happens on Windows x64. Fixes #1775
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add fixes to prevent potential build failures due to redist copying" (#1775)

Issues.Title: Change the <a> tags to <image> tags
Issues.Body:
In the RankerMetrics the `<a>`  tags for images will need to get converted to `<image>` tags, so the images display. 

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/master/src/Microsoft.ML.Data/Evaluators/Metrics/RankerMetrics.cs#L23
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change the <a> tags to <image> tags" (#1783)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Correcting Documentation, adding asserts and disabling failing ci tests" (#1777)

Issues.Title: FastTree uses lots of memory with dropout on
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**: Windows 10
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: .NET Core 2.1

### Issue

- **What did you do?**
Ran FastTreeRegressor with DropoutRate > 0.

- **What happened?**
Consumed around 15 GB of memory. Memory usage increased linearly with # of trees

Running FastTreeRegressor with DropoutRate > 0 leads to much higher memory consumption than when DropoutRate = 0. It used approx 14 GB more for 200 trees, and ran into an out of memory exception for 500 trees. Perhaps there is a leak? (Turning on DropoutRate seemed to consistently cause memory footprint to rise significantly.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FastTree uses lots of memory with dropout on" (#1781)

Issues.Title: Remove auto-cache mechanism
Issues.Body: Fixes #1604.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove auto-cache mechanism" (#1780)

Issues.Title: Microsoft.ML.Api - Code cleaned and if else blocks improved
Issues.Body:
We are excited to review your PR.

So we can do the best job, please check:

- [ ] There's a descriptive title that will make sense to other developers some time from now. 
- [ ] There's associated issues. All PR's should have issue(s) associated - unless a trivial self-evident change such as fixing a typo. You can use the format `Fixes #nnnn` in your description to cause GitHub to automatically close the issue(s) when your PR is merged.
- [x] Your change description explains what the change does, why you chose your approach, and anything else that reviewers should know.
- [ ] You have included any necessary tests in the same PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Microsoft.ML.Api - Code cleaned and if else blocks improved" (#1779)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Consider adding convenience functions to load / save models from / to files" (#1778)

Issues.Title: Extra Spaces in Baseline file for Netcoreapp3.0
Issues.Body:
TestName EntryPointPipelineEnsembleGetSummary

The original baseline file contains ```"Features.bare_nuclei\t%Number%  \t%Number% \t%Number%  \t%Number% ***"```
file - machinelearning\\test\\BaselineOutput\\Common\\EntryPoints\\ensemble-summary.txt"

baseline - "Features.bare_nuclei\t%Number%   \t%Number% \t%Number%  \t%Number% ***"
output -   "Features.bare_nuclei\t%Number%  \t%Number% \t%Number%  \t%Number% ***"

cc @eerhardt @danmosemsft @shauheen
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extra Spaces in Baseline file for Netcoreapp3.0" (#1776)

Issues.Title: Regression in Rff Code
Issues.Body:
I ran a benchmark provided to me By @justinormont  that uses Rff Transformer.
I ran it too on  master as well as on https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/commit/7d9660a3e3881e444f7a4212b175856aaa9bdbe0
and https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/commit/8b19930c3413b578b1b9603633f0e9ec30cd8acd

The time taken by the benchmark for both of the last two commit was around 850 ms for both netstandard as well as netcoreapp 3.0 implementation where as it was around 1.3 sec for the master branch.

I am working on adding the benchmark into the repo.
The rsp being used here is 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10516582/49246698-651ad200-f3ca-11e8-8f1e-4d4275a1aa98.png)



cc @adamsitnik @eerhardt @danmosemsft @shauheen
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Regression in Rff Code" (#1774)

Issues.Title: Official build can fail due to copying of the same redist assets
Issues.Body: Currently, all of the files under Redist are assumed to be RID specific, and get built/executed by every leg of the official build script. This is not the case for the DNNImageFeaturizer models, which means the same models get copied over from each RID leg (MacOS, Linux, etc) into the same destination container. This can cause issues if this happens at the exact same time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Official build can fail due to copying of the same redist assets" (#1773)

Issues.Title: GenericSpanSortHelper should have an overload that takes an IComparer
Issues.Body: This would enable sorting using a custom comparer, instead of the default CompareTo() method.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "GenericSpanSortHelper should have an overload that takes an IComparer" (#1772)

Issues.Title: PFI should work for multi class classification, clustering and recommendation
Issues.Body:
PFI currently only works for binary classification and regression. It should be extended to multi class classification, clustering and recommendation to provide explainability functionalities in other experiment categories.

The PFI approach works for all the above training scenarios, and it is natural for users that use the tool for binary classification/regression to also want to use it for other scenarios.

cc: @rogancarr
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PFI should work for multi class classification, clustering and recommendation" (#1771)

Issues.Title: MatrixFactorization cannot be found in the MLContext catalog
Issues.Body:
`MatrixFactorization` cannot be found in the MLContext catalog. MLContext.Recommendation is currently empty. 

This is with the 0.8.0-preview-27128-6 Microsoft.ML and Microsoft.ML.MatrixFactorization NuGets.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatrixFactorization cannot be found in the MLContext catalog" (#1770)

Issues.Title: Need example for one-class matrix factorization
Issues.Body:
Currently we only have [one test](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/533e18647a77c31f8149ccf2618ccb2e354f8e62/test/Microsoft.ML.Tests/TrainerEstimators/MatrixFactorizationTests.cs#L376) as our example. We should add one into our sample project. Also, in that actual example, we need to tell user to install MatrixFactorization nuget. The ultimate scope of the new example is to cover everything user needs to do to run one-class matrix factorization.

Also, because of some settings in our test framework, our tests are not examples which can be run by copy-and-paste.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need example for one-class matrix factorization" (#1769)

Issues.Title: Need XML doc string for each public field
Issues.Body: At ML.NET doc site, there are a lot of fields with empty description, for example, see [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.ml.trainers.matrixfactorizationtrainer.arguments?view=ml-dotnet). To make users' life easier, it'd be better to fill them with meaningful information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need XML doc string for each public field" (#1768)

Issues.Title: Need sample/code snippet for how to read and write from IDV files
Issues.Body: #1678 added the ability to save and load as binary (IDV) files. It would be useful to have a code snippet/sample to show how this can be done, with some remarks on why this is useful that show up in the docs website.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need sample/code snippet for how to read and write from IDV files " (#1767)

Issues.Title: Need PFI sample for binary classification
Issues.Body: This [PFI sample](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/3d33e20f33da70cdd3da2ad9e0b2b03df929bef4/docs/samples/Microsoft.ML.Samples/Dynamic/PermutationFeatureImportance.cs) has great detail, but it focuses on regression. Using PFI with binary classification requires a slightly different approach and it isn't immediately obvious how to do it. An additional sample explaining how to use PFI for binary classification would be quite helpful
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need PFI sample for binary classification" (#1766)

Issues.Title: Feature Contribution Calculator Documentation is Vague
Issues.Body: The [documentation](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/533e18647a77c31f8149ccf2618ccb2e354f8e62/src/Microsoft.ML.Data/Scorers/FeatureContributionCalculationTransform.cs#L29) for the Feature Contribution Calculation Transform is rather vague. It should be updated to talk about the feature, why it is useful, and point to the corresponding example.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature Contribution Calculator Documentation is Vague" (#1765)

Issues.Title: PFI BinaryClassification XML Documentation is Outdated
Issues.Body: The [sample documentation](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/533e18647a77c31f8149ccf2618ccb2e354f8e62/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/PermutationFeatureImportanceExtensions.cs#L86) for Binary Classification PFI is still the old text, while [regression documentation](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/533e18647a77c31f8149ccf2618ccb2e354f8e62/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/PermutationFeatureImportanceExtensions.cs#L14) is the new text. Let's update the binary classification documentation so that it's on par with the regression documentation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PFI BinaryClassification XML Documentation is Outdated" (#1764)

Issues.Title: Add a Filter for text-based columns
Issues.Body:
Afaik, the new filter APIs can target just numeric-based columns, but not text-based columns.
As of v0.8 we have: 
1) 
```
//FilterByColumn()

IDataView trainingDataView = mlContext.Data.FilterByColumn(baseTrainingDataView, "FareAmount", lowerBound: 1, upperBound: 150);
```

This is a very convenient filter, but for NUMERIC values. Iâ€™m currently using this for the sample code-snippet

2)
`FilterByKeyColumnFraction()`
Good for hashed values.

But if we want to filter by text-based columns, let's say I want to remove the rows where a text based column has no value (this might be doable when transforming to numeric values, then missing value is NaN and it will get filtered, but you need an additional not straightforward step) or to **remove specific rows when categorical values are equal to "some text"**, I think we cannot do that, yet.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add a Filter for text-based columns" (#1763)

Issues.Title: Sample for IID spike and changepoint detection using time series stateful prediction engine.
Issues.Body: Sample for IID spike and changepoint detection using time series stateful prediction engine. Fixes #978

Issues.Title: Fix bug in ApplyAt in VBufferUtils
Issues.Body:
When we create the editor, we lose the old values that were in the VBuffer in case it has to be resized.
Fixes #1756 .
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix bug in ApplyAt in VBufferUtils" (#1757)

Issues.Title: Name of MakePredictionFunction is confusing (to me).
Issues.Body:
I was following the start example in the Readme, and when I came to the line with MakePredictionFunction, I got a bit confused and had to go over it a few times before I could continue:

> Now from the model we can make inferences (predictions):
> 
> ```C#
> var predictionFunc = model.MakePredictionFunction<SentimentData, SentimentPrediction>(mlContext);
> var prediction = predictionFunc.Predict(new SentimentData
> {
>     SentimentText = "Today is a great day!"
> });
> Console.WriteLine("prediction: " + prediction.Prediction);
> ```

I expected the return value of `MakePredictionFunction()` to a function-type thing, but instead it was an object.  This was hard for me not because of pedantic correctness, but rather from a usability standpoint as a beginner trying to keep my concepts straight (estimators, transformers, models, etc.) this took me a step back and I had to go over the section several times to make sure I hadn't missed something.

Is there a better name that would be less confusing?
- `MakePredictionObject()`
- `MakePredictionEngine()`
- `MakePredictor()`
- ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Name of MakePredictionFunction is confusing (to me)." (#1761)

Issues.Title: The ColumnInfo structure should live in the estimators, rather than transformers
Issues.Body:
For OneHotEncoding estimator/transformer, ColumnInfo lives in the estimator. 
For most other pairs, ColumnInfo lives in the transformer. 

Standardize their location. 

I think they should live in the estimator, since they are mostly used on Estimator definition.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The ColumnInfo structure should live in the estimators, rather than transformers" (#1760)

Issues.Title: Remove ISchematized interface from the codebase.
Issues.Body:
1. Remove ISchematized
2. For any class that requires a Schema, we add a Schema as its field
3. Rename Schema to OutputSchema in IRowToRowMapper

Fixes #1502.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove ISchematized interface from the codebase." (#1759)

Issues.Title: Arguments class should be made internal when possible
Issues.Body: For transformers like `SlotsDroppingTransformer`, and most other OneToOneTransformers, we implement a ColumnInfo object that allows to set all the transformation specific parameters. We should therefore make the Arguments class internal, as it is only used for the command line.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Arguments class should be made internal when possible" (#1758)
